newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Hertz Corp started buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Hertz Corp started buy.

text.p: -- Lehman Brothers Inc started coverage of Hertz Corp with a buy rating and a 12-month price target of $32 a share, according to a research report.
-- It said the auto rental industry will sell at a 10-12 percent discount to the market, but said Hertz deserves the premium multiple in the group.

-- "With an estimated 20 percent EPS growth to $2 for 1998, we are forecasting the stock to climb to 16 to 17 times our 1998 estimate over the course for the next year," said analyst Jeff Kessler in the report.
-- Lehman was one of the underwriters of the company's $417.6 million initial public offering.
-- Kessler said in the report the estimates assume a five percent price increase in 1997 and three percent in 1998.
-- Hertz's Hertz Equipment Rental Corp unit "is growing over 20 percent internally and comprises 10 percent of revenues and over 30 percent of pretax income," it said.
-- Kessler said he estimated the company would earn $0.40 in the second quarter of 1997, $0.78 in the third quarter, and $0.27 in the fourth quarter, totalling $1.65 for 1997.
-- He cited the company's expertise in the used car sales market, selling cars bought "at risk" from original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) for its rental fleet through a series of dealerships.
-- Hertz shares jumped over 17 percent in early trading, rising 4-1/4 to 28-1/4, at their market debut on Friday.
-- Hertz is a unit of Ford Motor Co.
